title: (Pwn2Own) Cisco RV340 NGINX sessionid Directory Traversal Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Cisco RV340 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the configuration of the NGINX web server. When parsing the sessionid cookie, the process does not properly validate a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to bypass authentication on the system.
addtionnal_details: Cisco has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-smb-mult-vuln-KA9PK6D
timeline:
2021-11-24 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-02-22 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Bien Pham (@bienpnn) from Team Orca of Sea Security (security.sea.com)
